Content:: Connor Swift (born 30 October 1995) is an English racing cyclist, who currently rides for UCI ProTeam Arkéa–Samsic.[2] His cousin, Ben Swift, is also a professional cyclist. In 2018 he won the British National Road Race Championships.[3] In August 2018 Team Dimension Data announced that Swift would join the team as a stagiaire until the end of the season.[4] In May 2019 it was announced that Swift would join Arkéa–Samsic with immediate effect, with a role as a domestique for André Greipel.[5] In August 2020, he was named in the startlist for the 2020 Tour de France.[6]  This biographical article related to English cycling is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
